svg.content: <mxfile host="f35e4a33-6d69-457d-9758-fe15233f7b7d" modified="2020-08-21T01:05:03.430Z" agent="5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Code/1.47.3 Chrome/78.0.3904.130 Electron/7.3.2 Safari/537.36" etag="tYIK5wT-_liQu-X3-985" version="13.1.3"><diagram id="RTqvdanEotcw3ATUaWu8" name="css"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 922px; height: 4180px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 0px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; width: 922px; height: 4180px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; width: 100%; height: 100%; white-space: nowrap;

ol.li: in=2.54cm
px=1 / 96 of in
pt=1 / 72 of in
em - font size of the parent
rem - font size of the root element(html)
vw - viewport width, 1vw is 1% of the viewport width
vh - viewport height

/* ... */
for comment

,
separates diferent selectors

;
separates different properties

{}
wraps all properties

value -
p { color:
red
}

* -
universal selector
p - element selector, selects

#my-id - id selector, selects

or

.my-class - class selector, selects

or

img[src], img[src="my.png"] -
attribute selector, select image with
src
attribute or
src="my.png"

a:hover -
pseudo-class selector

::first-line, ::first-letter -
pseudo-element selector, selects a certain part of an element than the element itself

div > p -
direct chirdren selector

div p -
descendant selector

h1 + p - ajacent sibling selector, selects

directly after

at the same level of the HTML

h1 ~ p - general sibling selector, selects

with the same level after

of the HTML
cascade
specificity - weight from low to high, element has 0-0-1, class has 0-1-0, id has 1-0-0
inheritance
the box will break onto a new line
the box will extend in the line direction to fill the space available
the width and height properties will apply
padding, margin, and border will cause other elements to be pushed away from the box
the box will not break onto a new line

the
width
and
height
properties will not apply
vertical padding, margins, and borders will apply, but will not cause other inline boxes to move away from the box
horizontal padding, margins, and borders will apply and cause other inline boxes to move away from the box
the box will not break onto a new line

the
width
and
height
properties will apply
padding, margin, and border will cause other elements to be pushed away from the box

flex-direction: [row, column, row-reverse, column-reverse]
- the main axis runs in, the default is
row

flex-flow: row wrap
- shorthand for
flex-direction
and
flex-wrap

flex: 200px
- each element at least 200px wide

align-items: [flex-start, flex-end, center, baseline, stretch]
- where the flex items sit on the cross axis

justify-content: [space-around, center]
- where the flex items sit on the main axis

order: 0 - change the layout order of flex items, the default value is 0
, higher orders appear later

li.font: border: 1px solid red - short for {border-width border-style border-color}

ol.li:
font-size: 10px
- inherits from parent element

li.font: vertical-align: [baseline, sub, super, text-top, text-bottom, middle, top, bottom, 4px 2em 10%]

ol.li:
::selection
- select the text currently highlighted by the cursor

sans-serif:
[Helvetica, Arial, Verdana]

monospace:
["Courier New"]
shorthand for following attributes

li.font: outline: [solid, dashed, double, ridge, inset, none]

ol.li:
:link
- unvisited

:visited
- exists in the browser's history

list-style
- shorthand for the following attributes

list-style-image: url(ball.svg) -
better use
background-image

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
